name: St. Optatus
summary: Optatus was the bishop of Milevum (modern Mila, Algeria) in Numidia and an important early Church Father. He is best known for his work 'Against the Donatists,' which is a major source for understanding the Donatist controversy in North Africa. He argued for the unity of the Church and the validity of sacraments administered by unworthy ministers. His writings influenced Augustine of Hippo and other Church Fathers.
